PROTAGONISTS.Definition: the leading character or one of the major characters in a play, film, novel, etc

INGENIOUS.Definition: (of a machine or idea) cleverly and originally devised and well suited to its purpose

DUMMIES.Definition: a model or replica of a human being

NOTORIOUS.Definition: famous or well known, typically for some bad quality or deed

LURED.Definition: tricked into coming into a place

BRUTE.Definition: merely physical - 'brute' is typically used before 'force' to emphasis the physicality of the force

WRIGGLE.Definition: twist and turn with quick writhing movements, in this case to get out of something

CULT.Definition: a person or thing that is popular or fashionable among a particular group or section of society

TIDES.Definition: the alternate rising and falling of the sea, usually twice in each lunar day at a particular place, due to the attraction of the moon and sun

FEAT.Definition: an achievement that requires great courage, skill, or strength

RAFT.Definition: a small inflatable rubber or plastic boat, especially one for use in emergencies

INTRIGUING.Definition: arousing one's curiosity or interest; fascinating

SQUADRON.Definition: an operational unit in an air force consisting of two or more flights of aircraft and the personnel required to fly them

SHEER.Definition: nothing other than; unmitigated (used for emphasis)

BARBED WIRE.Definition: wire with clusters of short, sharp spikes, used to make fences or in warfare as an obstruction

IMPLICATED.Definition: show (someone) to be involved in a crime

EXTRADITED.Definition: hand over (a person accused or convicted of a crime) to a foreign state in which the crime was committed

BRIBE.Definition: dishonestly persuade (someone) to act in one's favour by a gift of money or other inducement
